review: This HDMI connecter Chrome Media Player was easy.  I plugged the Chrome stick into my HD TV and used my tablet to go to their setup site.  I logged in the code that popped up on the TV.  I find videos on my tablet and send it to TV via connected Chrome media stick.  So now I can watch YouTube, HuluPlus, Netflix...videos on my TV and use my tablet to surf net, play games or check email.
author: msschemist@yahoo.com

review: Loved my first one so much I bought a 2nd.  I'm finding more and more uses for this lovely $30 piece of magic.  I have a tablet and a phone so I'm able to control 2 Chromecasts at the same time.  Also being able to control it from my computer to stream a tab from my internet browser is nice too.  I'd recommend this for anyone that doesn't want to always use an xbox or ps4 or expensive computer to stream Netflix and Youtube to your tv.  It's nice I can sit back, put on a show... even control the volume from my tablet or phone.
author: Matthew

review: ...You just need to uninstall Microsoft Silverlight from your computer, and tell Chromecast to stream through Flash Player (you should get this option the first time you try to stream from Amazon Prime).  Of course you need to install Chromecast first, but the installation worked flawlessly on our system.Once you do this (and that's all simple to do), it works fine.  I suspect from other reviews that how well it works depends on your Internet speed, and how far your TV is from your router.  Some people report poor resolution or hangups in play... we have not had these problems, and it works fine for us.Very happy with it.
